A

aiMoveDumb() - Static method in class src.Main
Randomly picks an empty position from the board and places ai char in it
aiMoveSmart() - Static method in class src.Main
Calls minmax on every possible move to determine their likely outcome and places the ai move to the best score found (short)
aiTurn() - Static method in class src.Main
Ai decides if it should make its turn using the minmax algorithm (aiMovieSmart()) or make a completely random move (aiMoveDumb()) (short) The choice is based on the difficulty given by the player at the initializeGame method.
Algorithms - Class in src.util
This class includes algorithms usable in a game of tictactoe (short)

I

initializeGame() - Static method in class src.Main
Initializes the game by asking setting from the players, creating the board and filling it with char empty (short)

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class src.Main
 
Main - Class in src
A single player tictactoe that is played against an Ai opponent.
Main() - Constructor for class src.Main
 
minmax(char[][], char, char, char, int, boolean, int, int, int) - Static method in class src.util.Algorithms
minmax algorithm that works as the games ai by finding the most optimal move(short) minmax calls itself recursively on every single possible move and returns the value of the worst move possible in that branch so that the move that leads to the best possible outcome can be chosen(long)
MyConsole - Class in src.util
This class takes input from the user using console.
MyConsole() - Constructor for class src.util.MyConsole
 

P

playerTurn() - Static method in class src.Main
Asks player for their move, places it on the board and checks if the game is at an end state (short)
printBoard(char[][]) - Static method in class src.util.Ui
Prints out an 2d array with guide numbers for all the rows and columns.

R

readInt(int, int) - Static method in class src.util.MyConsole
This method returns an int value that has been asked from the user and checks that the input is correct.(short) A correct input is a number between or same as the min and max values and it's a int number.

W

winChecker(char[][], int, char, char, char) - Static method in class src.util.Algorithms
Checks if the player or ai has won the game and return an in value indicating either an end state or if game has not ended outputs which player has a longer row and both are doing equally well favours the ai .
